meanings.sent1: The semiarid desert only gets a small amount of rain each year.
meanings.sent2: The farmer struggled to grow crops in the semiarid climate.
meanings.sent3: The cactus in the semiarid land joked about needing a tiny umbrella.
meanings.sent4: Her writing style was like a semiarid landscape, sparse yet impactful.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cracked earth in the semiarid region was haunting.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a region that receives little rainfall.
meanings.sent1: The semiarid terrain was dry and dusty most of the year.
meanings.sent2: People living in semiarid areas often rely on water conservation methods.
meanings.sent3: The semiarid landscape seemed to be in a perpetual state of thirst.
meanings.sent4: Her humor was as dry as the semiarid climate she grew up in.
meanings.sent5: The wildlife in the semiarid zone had adapted to the scarce water sources.
